page.title: 08FARMS IN NORTH FAREHAM
page.content: Heytesbury Farm is typical of North Fareham.It is a mixed farm of 200ha. It has a dairy herd of 80 Friesian cattle which graze on permanent pasture on the clay soils,close to the buildings.The slurry from the cattle byres is used as fertiliser.Over most of the farm the fences and hedges have been removed to maximise the land available for cultivation,and to make the use of machinery easier.A rotation of grass,wheat,barley and potatoes is grown.There is also some woodland on the farm,but it is only felled for the farmer's own use.The farm is highly mechanised,and the fields are large by Hampshire standards enabling the use of the farm's huge combine harvesters.The farmer maximises his output by the use of fertilisers, pesticides and weedkillers.
